panel.visibility: sideview 'sampler' ? false : sideview 'automix' ? false : sideview 'sidelist' ? false : sideview 'karaoke' ? false : sideview 'remixes' ? false : true

filelist.visibility: browser_window 'sideview' ? sideview 'sampler' ? sideview_triggerpad ? false : true : true : true

button.visibility: sideview 'sampler' ? false : sideview 'automix' ? false : sideview 'sidelist' ? false : sideview 'karaoke' ? false : sideview 'remixes' ? false : true

text.text: Power Off The Player ?
POWER OFF
Restart in Standalone mode ?

text.format: A song is already playing on this deck.\nAre you use you want to stop it?

button.action: set '@$denonwavebeats' 0 & setting 'SkinWaveformScratchType' 'Shapes' & setting 'SkinWaveformType' 'Shapes' & set '@$denonshapescolors' 0 & setting 'SkinWaveformScratchType' 'shapes' & setting 'loadSecurity' 'on' & setting 'multiTouchTwoFingerScroll' 0 & set '@$primelistappend' 0 & set '@$primebrowserinfo' 0 & set '@$denonwavelock' 0 & set '@$denonblinktime' 0 & setting 'KeyDisplay' 'Harmonic' & setting 'autoKey' 0 & set '@$primeshowalbum' 0 & set '@$primebrowserauto' 0 & grid_view off & setting 'WaveformCenter' 'Centered' & setting 'ColoredWaveforms' 'monochrome' & set '@$denonneedlelock' 0 & set '@$denonhidepads' 0

text.text: Reset to Default
Standalone mode
Choose if Pads will be visible on the Deck View.

text.format: When enabled, Track Time on Deck and Jogwheel Ring Led will blink when the track is near its End\nThe time before End can be defined from VirtualDJ Options tab of Settings(endOfSongWarning setting)

text.text: Select the type for the Musical Key value of the Track displayed on Decks and Browser
When enabled, tracks loaded to a Deck will automatically match the Key of the other Deck
When set to Yes, the Album Art of the loaded Track will be displayed on the Track Info area of the Deck.
When enabled, the Song Progress Wave area of the Deck will be protected from touch.
When set to No, tracks will load to Decks even if playing.
Select between Center and Left Align for the Scratch Waves
Select the Type of the Waves.
Select the Colors of the Waves
Show extra Grid-Lines in Scratch Wave
When set to Yes, the Scratch Waves area will be blocked from touching.
Show or Hide Bar : Beats numbers on Waves
When set to Yes, the selected Track's Info panel will be displayed at the right side of Browser.

text.format: When enabled, the Browser will be automatically enlarged when Browser actions are performed, such as \nscrolling, changing Browser panels, searching etc, and will be automatically shrinked if a Track is loaded\nor no Browser action is performed within 5 seconds.

text.text: Select between the List and Grid view for the Browser

text.format: When enabled, the Folders that you choose to add to Sidelist (Automix, Sidelist, Karaoke) \nwill append their tracks at the end of the current list, instead of replacing

When set to Yes, scrolling the Browser lists will require two fingers while dragging will require one finger.\nWhen set to No, scrolling will require one finger and dragging will be offered with one finger on the Album\nArt in Grid view.

text.text: Select the Attenuation for Microphones
Select if Microphone will be heard through Booth Output
Enable/Disable Microphone Talkover functionality
